DataElement.preferredName: PROMIS Version 2 Adult Mental Health Domain Cognitive Function PC2r Past 7 Days Thinking Has Been Slow Score 5 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Persons' stated observation of how often in the past seven days their thinking has been slow, using a five-point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: PROMIS Adult Mental Health Domain Cognitive Function Past Week Thinking Has Been Slow Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A Patient Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System (PROMIS) domain that assesses the status of an individual's mental health._The collection of PROMIS item scales that assess perceived difficulties in intellectual processes, capabilities, and deficits._The most recent week, including today._A question about whether an individual's thinking is or has been slow._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ValueDomain.preferredName: PROMIS Quantitative Frequency Score 5 Point Scale
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An ordered reference standard used with the PROMIS items that describes a range of subjective scores for representing how often an individual experiences something from 1: Never, to 5: Very Often (Several times a day).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: From time to time, but not continually or always.

Concepts.definition: From time to time, but not continually or always.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: On most occasions, or in most situations.

Concepts.definition: On most occasions, or in most situations.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer that something occurs frequently.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer that something occurs frequently.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not ever; at no time in the past (or future).

Concepts.definition: Not ever; at no time in the past (or future).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

Concepts.definition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Scoring and Interpretation Link
ReferenceDocuments.description: Scoring and Interpretation materials are available from the PROMIS Assessment Center.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. The URL citation is provided so that caDSR users can obtain materials related to instructions for administering and/or scoring the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. Where an investigator wants to use single Patient Reported Outcome items that are integrated into a study, DCP review is required prior to inclusion of the item on a case report form.
